titleStmt.title: Inscription in honour of the praet. prefect Probus from Verona

summary.term: Honorary inscription for the praetorian prefect Probus

support.rs: yes: it was reused in a church, probably the Duomo of Verona

layout.rs: At the time of its transcription, the inscription was undamaged. The inscription is known only from manuscripts (by Michele Fabrizio Ferrarini in 1477-1486 ca., and by Jacques Sirmond more than a Century later).

history.provenance: first recorded in a church in Verona at the end of the 15th Century

div.ab:
Petronio
Probo viro clarissimo,
totius admira
tionis viro, pro
consuli Africae, praefecto
praetorio Illyrici,
praefecto praetorio Gal
liarum II, praefecto praetorio
Italiae atque Africae
III, consuli ordinario,
civi eximiae boni
tatis, disertissimo
atque omnibus
rebus eruditissimo,
patrono,
nepoti Probiani,
filio Probini vvirorum cclarissimorum,
praefectorum urbis et conssulum.
?

app.note: praef(ecto) praet(orio) Gal/liar[u]m, praef(ecto) praet(orio): Porena forthcoming.

div.p: Ferrarini; Traiectinus (Utrecht, Universiteitsbibliotheek, HS. 765, f.° 19’) 1477: PETRONIO / PROBO VC / TOTIVS ADMIRA/TIONIS VIRO PRO/CONS AFRICAE PRAEF / PRAETORIO ILLYICI / PRAE ET / PRAEFEC / GALLIAR II PRAEF PRAET / ITALIAE ATQ AFRICAE / IIII COS ORDINARIO / CIVI EXIMIAE BONI/TATIS DISERTISSIMO / ATQ OMNIB / REBVS ERVDITISSIM / PATRONO / NEPOTI PROBIANI / FILIO PROBINI VV CC / PRAEF VRBIS ET COSS

Id., Parisinus Lat. 6128 Bibl. Nat., f° 18’ (?): PETRONIO / PROBO VC / TOTIVS ADMIRA/TIONIS VIRO PRO/CONS AFRICAE / PRAEF / PRAETORIO ILLYRICI / PRAE ET PRAEFEC GAL/LIAR. II PRAEF PRAET / ITALIAE ATQ AFRICAE / III CON ORDINARIO / CIVI EXIMIAE BONI/TATIS DISERTISSIMO / ATQ OMNIB / REBVS ERVDITISSIM / PATRONO / NEPOTI PROBIANI / FILIO PROBINI VV CC / PRAEF VRBIS ET CONSS

Id., Regiense C 398, f° 48 - 1486: PETRONIO / PROBO VC TOTIVS / ADMIRATIONIS VIRO PRO/CONS AFRICAE PRAEF / PRAETORIO ILLYRICI PRAE / ET PRAEFEC GALLIAR II PRAEF / PRAET ITALIAE ATQ AFRICAE / III CON ORDINARIO CIVI EX/IMIAE BONITATIS DISERTISS / ATQ OMNIB REBVS ERVDITISS/MO PATRONO NEPOTI PRO/BIANI FILIO PROBINI VV CC / PRAEF VRBIS ET COSS

Sirmond, Paris Bibl. Nat. Lat. 9696 (già Suppl. Lat. 1417), p. 2 n. 13: PETRONIO / PROBO VC / TOTIVS ADMIRA’TIONIS VIRO / PRO’CONS AFRICAE PRAEF’ / PRAETORIO ILLYICI’ / PRAEF PRAET GAL’LIAR II / PRAEF PRAET’ ITALIAE / ATQ AFRICAE’ III / CONS ORDINARIO’ / CIVI EXIMIAE BONI’TATIS DISERTISSIMO’ ATQVE / OMNIBVS’ REBVS ERVDITISSIMO’ / PATRONO / NEPOTI PROBIANI’ FILIO / PROBINI VV CC’ PRAEF VRBIS / ET CONSS

“To Petronius Probus, of clarissmus rank, man worthy of all admiration, proconsul of Africa, praetorian prefect of Illyricum, for the second time praetorian prefect of the Gauls, for the third time praetorian prefect of Italy and Africa, ordinary consul, citizen of extraordinary goodness, most eloquent and most learned in all things, patron, grandson of Probianus, son of Probinus, of clarissimus rank, urban prefects and consuls.”

“A Petronius Probus, chiarissimo, uomo degno di ogni ammirazione, proconsole d’Africa, prefetto del pretorio dell’Illirico, per la seconda volta prefetto del pretorio delle Gallie, per la terza volta prefetto del pretorio d’Italia e d’Africa, console ordinario, cittadino dall’esimia bontà, eloquentissimo ed eruditissimo in ogni cosa, patrono, nipote di Probiano, figlio di Probino, chiarissimi, prefetti urbani e consoli.”
